channel.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
channel.description:
HL2 Beta vs. HL2 Retail who do you think is better? First. Weapon Comparison, We all know that HL2 Beta weapons are very different than the HL2 Retail weapons,The AR2 has a complete story about it,But even before the AR2 was created, There was the Incendiary Rifle, It can incinerate any living thing that is pointed to the gun, All weapons can be found here because I can't put all the things in one Topic XD So I will just give you pics and the website to read the info.
Here is the Concept art of Gordon,Alyx,Eli,Dog and Skitch: [url]https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/File:Concept_art_eli_gordon_alyx_skitch.jpg[/url]
The Beta Menu of 2003 and 2002 and info of the Beta: [url]https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Half-Life_2_Beta[/url]
Tell which is better. ![Irifle.gif|1x1](upload://eh55bGx0GccMpYbsRdgSzRO2lrg.gif) ![Irifle.gif|1x1](upload://eh55bGx0GccMpYbsRdgSzRO2lrg.gif)

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Gordon-Freeman:

See guys just that simple, they need to add more!

So the whole plot of Eli getting abducted, mossman turning on you and the the uprising happening because you managed to steal Eli back from nova prospekt, and taking out the Overwatch Nexus just never happened in the game?

It seems like you remembered everything except… the plot.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: mouserider
item.description:
the old concepts probably wouldn’t have worked as a game. they were fine for demonstrating the capabilities of the engine and some cool sceneries with the overall idea of the game, but they had to go.

no matter how you look at it, the beta is an underdeveloped stage of the game. besides, many chapters are clearly visible in the final cut, only drastically altered for the sake of gameplay. there’s no way the beta would’ve made this far without valve “butchering” it.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Ok, god damnit, IF THE OLD CONCEPT WAS SO GOOD, HOW COME VALVE DECIDED TO CHANGE IT FOR SOMETHING DIFFERENT? UH?

IT’S LIKE YOU GUYS CAN’T EVEN THINK THROUGH THIS SHIT! :FFFUUU:

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Gordon-Freeman
item.description:
lambda:

But it was a good idea!

Yes, Lambda is right, It was a good idea. You got to see more of what happened to the whole world except of… uhh lemme put this into words:

1: G-Man puts you in train

2: Get H.E.V Suit and get crowbar from Barney.

3: Kill aliens and Combine people.

4: Arrive to citadel.

5: Kill Breen.

See guys just that simple, they need to add more!

Read full topic

item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
The reason was because the game wasn’t anywhere near finished. The leak had nothing to do with it. The original half-life was delayed an extra year, and nearly every game Valve has worked on has been delayed at some point or another because it didn’t meet their quality standards. There were plenty of NPCs cut from HL1, and probably a lot of maps & other things we don’t know about, and the reason we don’t know about them is because they weren’t leaked.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: mouserider
item.description:
the gist is, valve delayed the game shortly after the leak. and that is the reason of the rumour (let’s face it, it’s just a rumour) that they had to change most of the content because of it. the leak might have had some role in the changes of the original plan but most of it was purely for a storytelling and gameplay point of view.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
It doesn’t make sense anyway. Why throw away some perfectly good content just to spite some hackers? If you decide it’d be better to change it anyway, then fair enough, but it seems a pretty poor reason to change it just for that.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Lost one:

I actually did research, I thought the reason this concept of the game was discarded was because someone hacked the Valve servers and got a copy of the leak and distributed it amongst the populace.

That is completely and utterly untrue. Most of the leak content that people fixate over was last modified a year or two before the leak, and the leak also contains a lot of the finalized content in a much less polished form, which if the game were changed because of the leak wouldn’t make any sense for it to be in the leak.

Next time try doing more research.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

ect.

:hmph:

item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Lost_one
item.description:
I actually did research, I thought the reason this concept of the game was discarded was because someone hacked the Valve servers and got a copy of the leak and distributed it amongst the populace. Think of it from Valve’s point of view, would you continue working on a project you want to surprise the populace with on the final version if it got out? or would you start over making sure that it didn’t get out again? Personally I wouldn’t work on it if it’s been leaked to the point people can play it. If they can’t wait, I’ll let them keep their half finished game. Restart the project and take it in a different direction so when it finally does come out they won’t know how the story goes, how to solve the puzzles, ect.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail

item.title: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Things change for a reason. So the old concept had cooler and creepier designs, but it’s possible that overall Valve wasn’t satisfied with how those concepts meshed together. Most of the time, game designers come up with set-pieces that look cool on paper, but that don’t really add up to the general sense of the game, so they get scrapped.

That’s what happened with Half-Life 2 over the years it was in production. It was originally going to be a longer and darker game, but it’s very much possible that Valve decided that it was too long and some of the original concepts would just ruin the overall pace of the game, so they changed it into something more short-ish and not so dark.

Read full topic
item.source: Half Life 2 Beta vs. Half Life 2 Retail
